author: Special Correspondent
text:
Secretary, Salem district unit of the Indian Red Cross Society,L. Raja Sundar Singh, handed over certificates to the YRC volunteers in Salem recently.

Training in first aid techniques, special sessions on disaster management and maintaining public health marked the day long district level study camp for the Youth Red Cross volunteers of polytechnic colleges in Salem, Namakkal, Dharmapuri and Krishnagiri districts at Rajaji Polytechnic College here on Saturday.

The camp was organised by the Salem zone unit of the Youth Red Cross.

M. V. Rangarajan, Correspondent, Rajaji Polytechnic College, in his inaugural address, lauded the role played by the Red Cross movement in offering treatment and saving the precious lives of the soldiers during wars.

Badrinathan, Principal, Rajaji Polytechnic College, Govindan, Director, Annapoorna College of Engineering, V. Ramakrishnan, coordinator of the YRC of polytechnic colleges, offered felicitations at the inaugural.

Later at the sessions that followed, Ramakrishna, first aid expert, imparted training on various first aid techniques to the participants.

He demonstrated the techniques.

Ilango, health supervisor, Veerapandi union, addressed the session on ‘public health’ and Loganathan, coordinator, Namakkal district unit of the YRC, explained the various disaster management techniques at another session.

L. Raja Sundar Singh, secretary of the Salem district unit of the Indian Red Cross Society, was the chief guest at the valediction of the camp and he explained the various programmes organised for creating awareness among the younger generation on the activities of the YRC.

He gave away certificates to all the participants at the end.
title: Training in first aid techniques held
